title: Authorities search for boys, 3 and 4, who were taken by their non-registered sex offender father
text:
New Mexican authorities are seeking the public's help in locating two little boys who were allegedly taken by their father, a non-registered sex offender.

The La Cruces Police Department said in a Tuesday Facebook post that Maverick Ransom, 3, and his four-year-old brother - Orion - have not been seen since October 8.

The department added that the two kids were last seen with their father, 52-year-old Clarence Michael Ransom, who had picked them up from the Las Cruces daycare center.

The La Cruces Police Department said on Tuesday that Maverick Ransom, 3, and his four-year-old brother - Orion - have not been seen since October 8

Police believe that Ransom traveled to Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, on the same day that the children were last seen. He is said to have returned to the United States on the following day.

'It’s not known if he took his two sons with him and their whereabouts are unknown,' police added in the release.

Ransom is a non-registered sex offender - which is a federal offense - and is said to be 5'11" and 195lbs.

They were last seen with their father, 52-year-old Clarence Michael Ransom, who had picked them up from the Las Cruces daycare center

The father was last seen driving a silver 2013 Toyota Camry with temporary tags.

Both of the boys are said to be 3'6" and are roughly 30lbs.

Ransom is said to have not informed his estranged wife about his intentions to travel with their children. The two share custody of the boys.

'A nationwide warrant has been issued for Ransom’s arrest,' the release stated. 'The warrant charges Ransom with failure to register as a sex offender and non-compliance with a custodial agreement.'
description: The La Cruces Police Department said in a Tuesday Facebook post that Maverick Ransom, 3, and his four-year-old brother - Orion - have not been seen since October 8.
